intro: Chiritopsis glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular chiritopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in the spring, and the plant produces small, capsule-like fruits. Chiritopsis glandulosa is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
